APPLY_NOW.LINE3: We're here to help you succeed.

ABOUT_US.ABOUT_US_INTRO: 帮助用户实现自助贷款
ABOUT_US.STORY1: A proudly Canadian company, we are founded and based out of Toronto Ontario with one mission: Empower clients to build and obtain their mortgage with the best possible rates, backed by an experienced full service team. We offer a unique level of service that makes “shopping” the mortgage market easy. When you are ready to secure financing or are thinking of needing financing, be it for a purchase, refinance or switch, simply connect with us. We are able to provide you with unbiased advice and personal consultation throughout the process.
ABOUT_US.STORY2: Our online DIY platform empowers our clients to fill out their application. We will evaluate the application and provide our clients the advice and plan they need to make the right decision with the best possible rate. All applications are secured and sent electronically to our network of lenders depending on specific financing requirements. Our service policy is to ensure all parties are kept informed throughout the transaction. Our commitment is to make the approval process seamless, efficient, and simple.
ABOUT_US.SPEC1_DESCRIPTION: Buying your first home is a big financial decision and can be an overwhelming process, but you won’t be doing it alone. You’ll have a whole mortgage firm working with you.
ABOUT_US.SPEC2_DESCRIPTION: As entrepreneurs, we offer a unique understanding of the challenges involved in applying for a mortgage if you are self-employed. We have the knowledge to guide you through this process.
ABOUT_US.SPEC3_DESCRIPTION: In a new country, nothing says you’ve arrived like a new home. Our team has access to innovative programmes offered to new Canadians.
ABOUT_US.SPEC4_DESCRIPTION: Don’t qualify at the banks? We specialize in helping families with complicated credit history obtain their mortgage.
ABOUT_US.KEY1_DESCRIPTION: We believe in keeping things simple with no strings attached. We help clients build their mortgage plan and secure their funding.
ABOUT_US.KEY2_DESCRIPTION: We believe every client, big or little, should receive a customized mortgage plan and receive the advice they need to make the right decision and find the product most suitable for their situation. Our client satisfaction rate is second to none.
ABOUT_US.KEY3_TITLE: Backed by an Experienced Full Service Team
ABOUT_US.KEY3_DESCRIPTION: We believe clients can get the best online DIY mortgage rates and still receive the best service in the industry.

CONTACT_US.TITLE: 联系我们
CONTACT_US.NAME: 姓名（不少于两个字符）
CONTACT_US.CORRECT_EMAIL: 请输入正确的电子邮箱地址

CALCULATOR_AFFORDABILITY.AFFORDABILITY_INTRO: 计算是否能负担起所供房产
CALCULATOR_AFFORDABILITY.ANNUAL_INCOME_B4TAX_TOOLTIPTXT: 您的税前总收入，包含奖金和额外收入
CALCULATOR_AFFORDABILITY.COAPP_INCOME_B4TAX: 合伙申请人年收入（税前）：
CALCULATOR_AFFORDABILITY.COAPP_INCOME_B4TAX_TOOLTIPTXT: 您的共同申请人的税前总收入。你们的合并收入将用于计算你们可以共同承担的贷款总额
CALCULATOR_AFFORDABILITY.LIVING_COST_TITLE_DESCRIPTION: （如需包括该项请点击右侧选择框）
CALCULATOR_AFFORDABILITY.PROPERTY_TAX_TOOLTIPTXT: 您所在城市征收的房产税。我们所使用的是您所在省份的平均值
CALCULATOR_AFFORDABILITY.CONDO_FEES_TOOLTIPTXT: 公寓物业管理费包括常见的建筑和维护费。我们所使用的默认估值为300加元
CALCULATOR_AFFORDABILITY.HEATING_COSTS_TOOLTIPTXT: 公寓所需热水及暖气的总费用。我们使用的默认估值为省平均值
CALCULATOR_AFFORDABILITY.CREDIT_CARD_TOOLTIPTXT: 未偿还信用卡余额的平均利息。这不包括余额本身，只包括利息部分
CALCULATOR_AFFORDABILITY.CAR_PAYMENT_TOOLTIPTXT: 您在任何家用车辆上的租赁或融资费用
CALCULATOR_AFFORDABILITY.OTHER_LOAN_EXPANSES_TOOLTIPTXT: 任何其他贷款费用，如信贷额度，学生贷款，赡养费或子女抚养费
CALCULATOR_AFFORDABILITY.HOW_TO_ESTIMATE_P1: Lenders look at two ratios when determining the mortgage amount you qualify for, which generally indicate how much you can afford. These ratios are called the Gross Debt Service (GDS) ratio and Total Debt Service (TDS) ratio. They take into account your income, monthly housing costs and overall debt load.
CALCULATOR_AFFORDABILITY.HOW_TO_ESTIMATE_P2: The first affordability rule, as set out by the Canada Mortgage and Housing Corporation (CMHC), is that your monthly housing costs – mortgage principal and interest, taxes and heating expenses (P.I.T.H.) - should not exceed 32% of your gross household monthly income. For condominiums, P.I.T.H. also includes half of your monthly condominium fees. The sum of these housing costs as a percentage of your gross monthly income is your GDS ratio.
CALCULATOR_AFFORDABILITY.HOW_TO_ESTIMATE_P3: The CMHC’s second affordability rule is that your total monthly debt load, including housing costs, should not be more than 40% of your gross monthly income. In addition to housing costs, your total monthly debt load would include credit card interest, car payments, and other loan expenses. The sum of your total monthly debt load as a percentage of your gross household income is your TDS ratio.
CALCULATOR_AFFORDABILITY.HOW_TO_ESTIMATE_P4: Note that while the industry guideline for GDS and TDS is 32% and 40% respectively, most borrowers with good credit and steady income will be allowed to exceed these limits. The maximum allowed is 39% and 44%. The calculator uses these maximums to estimate affordability.
CALCULATOR_AFFORDABILITY.DOWN_PAYMENT_P1: Your down payment is a benchmark used to determine your maximum affordability. Ignoring income and debt levels, you can determine how much you can afford to spend using a simple calculation:
CALCULATOR_AFFORDABILITY.DOWN_PAYMENT_P2: If your down payment is $25,000 or less, you can find your maximum purchase price using this formula: down payment / 5% = maximum affordability. If your down payment is $25,001 or more, you can find your maximum purchase price using this formula: down payment amount - $25,000 / 10% + $500,000. For example, if you have saved $50,000 for your down payment, the maximum home price you could afford would be $50,000 - $25,000 = $25,000 / 10% = $250,000 + $500,000 = $750,000. Any mortgage with less than a 20% down payment is known as a high-ratio mortgage, and requires you to purchase mortgage default insurance, commonly referred to as CMHC insurance.
CALCULATOR_AFFORDABILITY.CASH_REQ_OTHER_QUALIFICATIONS_TITLE: 所需现金及其他满足贷款条件
CALCULATOR_AFFORDABILITY.CASH_REQ_OTHER_QUALIFICATIONS_CONTENT: In addition to your down payment and CMHC insurance, you should set aside 1.5% - 4% of your home's selling price to cover closing costs, which are payable on closing day. Many home buyers forget to account for closing costs in their cash requirement. In addition to your debt service ratios, down payment, and cash for closing costs, mortgage lenders will also consider your credit history and your income when qualifying you for a mortgage. All of these factors are equally important. For example even if you have good credit, a sizeable down payment, and no debts, but an unstable income, you might have difficulty getting approved for a mortgage. Keep in mind that the mortgage affordability calculator can only provide an estimate of how much you'll be approved for, and assumes you’re an ideal candidate for a mortgage. To get the most accurate picture of what you qualify for, speak to a mortgage broker about getting a mortgage pre-approval.

CALCULATOR_MONTHLY_PAYMENT.MONTHLY_PAYMENT_INTRO: 计算是否能负担起月供费用
CALCULATOR_MONTHLY_PAYMENT.MONTHLY_PAYMENT_CALCULATOR_DETAILS: 我们所提供的每月月供计算器会计算您的每月付款并显示相应的摊还时间计划，允许您在购置房产前测试各种付款及摊销方案，并比较不同的开放式和封闭式贷款利率。我们还帮助您计算相应的贷款保险及房产转让税
CALCULATOR_MONTHLY_PAYMENT.DOWN_PAY_TOOLTIPTXT: 您为获得贷款所需要支付的金额。加拿大政府规定首付最低金额为5％。对于低于20％的首付，购房者必须购买贷款违约保险，通常称为CMHC保险
CALCULATOR_MONTHLY_PAYMENT.MORTGAGE_INSURANCE_TOOLTIPTXT: 贷款违约保险，通常称为CMHC保险，是用于在借款人违约的情况下保护贷款人。所有首付低于20％的贷款，即高比率贷款，都要求贷款人缴纳贷款违约保险。贷款违约保险金额是按照贷款金额的一定比重计算得出
CALCULATOR_MONTHLY_PAYMENT.AMORTIZATION_PERIOD_TOOLTIPTXT: 房主偿还贷款所需的时长。在加拿大，可保贷款的最高摊还期限为25年。较长的摊还期允许房主每月支付较少的款项，但相当于在贷款期限内支付更多的利息
CALCULATOR_MONTHLY_PAYMENT.MORTGAGE_RATE_TOOLTIPTXT: 您将需要支付贷款余额的利率，这是由贷款类型和贷款机构决定的。在您获得贷款批准之前，利率可以随时改变

CALCULATOR_LAND_TRANSFER_TAX.LAND_TRANSFER_TAX_INTRO: 计算所供房产所需地税
CALCULATOR_LAND_TRANSFER_TAX.LAND_TRANSFER_TAX_CALCULATOR_TITLE: 安大略省土地转让税计算
CALCULATOR_LAND_TRANSFER_TAX.TORONTO_PROPERTY: 房产是否位于多伦多市？
CALCULATOR_LAND_TRANSFER_TAX.TORONTO_TAX: 多伦多土地转让税总额：
CALCULATOR_LAND_TRANSFER_TAX.LAND_TRANSFER_TAX_RATE_HEADING: 安大略省土地转让税利率-（于2017年更新）
CALCULATOR_LAND_TRANSFER_TAX.LAND_TRANSFER_TAX_RATE_PARAGRAPH: 安大略省房产转让税（LTT）是一种递进税，房产价值的每个部分都按照特殊的税率征税。税率如下:
CALCULATOR_LAND_TRANSFER_TAX.LAND_TRANSFER_TAX_REBATE_HEADING: 安大略省土地转让税退税条件
CALCULATOR_LAND_TRANSFER_TAX.LAND_TRANSFER_TAX_REBATE_PARAGRAPH: 对于首次购房者，安大略省房产转让税的最高退税额为4000加元。根据安大略省的房产转让税率，此退款将包括最高达368,333加元的全额房产税。对于购买价格超过368,333加元的物业，买家将获得全额4,000加元的退税额并支付剩余的房产转让税（LLT）余额。例如：
CALCULATOR_LAND_TRANSFER_TAX.FIRSTTIME_ELIGIBILITY_HEADING: 安大略省购置首套房买家满足条件
CALCULATOR_LAND_TRANSFER_TAX.FIRSTTIME_ELIGIBILITY_P1: 您必须是加拿大公民或加拿大永久居民
CALCULATOR_LAND_TRANSFER_TAX.FIRSTTIME_ELIGIBILITY_P3: 您必须在购买后9个月内自住该房产
CALCULATOR_LAND_TRANSFER_TAX.FIRSTTIME_ELIGIBILITY_P4: 您不可以在世界任何地方拥有任何房产
CALCULATOR_LAND_TRANSFER_TAX.FIRSTTIME_ELIGIBILITY_P5: 您的配偶在作为您的配偶时不能拥有房产（但可以是以前的房主）
CALCULATOR_LAND_TRANSFER_TAX.FIRSTTIME_ELIGIBILITY_P6: 如果是新建房产则必须在房产保修期内
CALCULATOR_LAND_TRANSFER_TAX.FIRSTTIME_ELIGIBILITY_P7: 购房者必须在购买房产后18个月内申请退款
CALCULATOR_LAND_TRANSFER_TAX.FIRSTTIME_REBATE_HEADING: 安大略省购置首套房买家退税申请
CALCULATOR_LAND_TRANSFER_TAX.FIRSTTIME_REBATE_P1: 纳税人可以在登记房产转让文件和缴纳税款时立即申请退款。通常情况下您的律师会在成交时代表您申请退税。如果您在登记时没有及时申请退税并支付了全额税款，您也可以在18个月内向财政部提出退税申请。申请所需的资料包括：
CALCULATOR_LAND_TRANSFER_TAX.FIRSTTIME_REBATE_P2: 安大略省房产转让税退税宣誓书（Ontario Land Transfer Tax Refund Affidavit）。仅适用于首次购买符合条件房产的买家
CALCULATOR_LAND_TRANSFER_TAX.FIRSTTIME_REBATE_P3: 注册房产转让契约（Registered Land Transfer Deed）（复印件）
CALCULATOR_LAND_TRANSFER_TAX.FIRSTTIME_REBATE_P4: 购买和销售协议（Agreement of Purchase and Sale）（复印件）
CALCULATOR_LAND_TRANSFER_TAX.FIRSTTIME_REBATE_P5: 能够充当居住证明的相关文件（例如驾驶执照，电话/网费账单等）（复印件）
CALCULATOR_LAND_TRANSFER_TAX.GOV_LAND_TRANSFER_TAX: “如何计算房产转让税”-安大略省财政部官网（英文）
CALCULATOR_LAND_TRANSFER_TAX.GOV_FIRST_TIME_BUYER_REFUNDS: “首套房产购买者房产转让税退税指南”-安大略省财政部官网（英文）

DASHBOARD.OFFER1CONTENT: 我们可以帮助您提供商业贷款以资助您投资新的商业房产(如餐厅、商铺等)，帮助您实现房地产投资组合的多样化
DASHBOARD.OFFER2CONTENT: 如果您的房贷在贷款期末尚未还清，您需要就未还清的贷款额自助尋找最佳房贷的类型及本金和利息还款金额及新的还款期和利率
DASHBOARD.OFFER3CONTENT: 祝贺您！使用我们的平台助您找到最适合您的房屋贷款，让您輕鬆愉快地购置自己的第一套房屋
DASHBOARD.OFFER4CONTENT: 基于您当前的收入和信用记录，以书面形式声明您有资格获得房屋贷款及需要满足的一系列条件。预先批准通常会说明期限、利率和房屋贷款金额
DASHBOARD.OFFER5CONTENT: 无论您要购置第二套房屋、度假屋，还是出租物业，我们都能帮助您了解可选择的贷款方案
DASHBOARD.OFFER6CONTENT: 五大銀行一般只接受常规房屋贷款, 如果您有特殊貸款情況可以經我們系統自助尋找愿意貸款的最佳私人贷款机构
DASHBOARD.OFFER7CONTENT: 您的房屋可以成为您最有效的金融借贷工具。房屋资产净值信用贷款以您房屋的资产净值作抵押，让您获得低利率信用贷款
DASHBOARD.OFFER8CONTENT: 了解再贷款及重組的原因、需要考虑的因素以及面对的不同选择。使用我們的平台按你喜好及需要隨心所慾地選擇重組或再贷款的細節
DASHBOARD.WORK1CONTENT: Clients come first. Full Stop. We make it simple to help you get your mortgage.
DASHBOARD.WORK2CONTENT: Free advice to help you with your mortgage needs.
DASHBOARD.WORK3CONTENT: We are not restricted to one proprietary product. Our open product shelf enables us to find you the most suitable product with the best rate.
DASHBOARD.WORK4CONTENT: We work for you, not the Bank. You can count on our advice being impartial because we don't work for the lender. We always act in our clients' best interests.

HOW_IT_WORKS.HOW_IT_WORKS_INTRO: 只需三分钟，即可自助申请贷款！
HOW_IT_WORKS.STEP1CONTENT: Find the best mortgage solution in less than 5 minutes using our proprietary online builder.
HOW_IT_WORKS.STEP2CONTENT: Our system will automatically help you get the mortgage and we will reach out if we need more information.
HOW_IT_WORKS.STEP3CONTENT: Once we received the final commitment, we will finalized the closing details with your lawyer, saving you time and hassle.
HOW_IT_WORKS.STEP4CONTENT: On your closing date, the funds will be directed to your lawyer.
HOW_IT_WORKS.MOREQSEC1: More questions on what to expect? Head on over to our
HOW_IT_WORKS.MOREQSEC3: or contact us using our Contact Form
HOW_IT_WORKS.QUESTION1TITLE: Q: How do I get started?
HOW_IT_WORKS.QUESTION1SECTION: Simply click on the Mortgage Builder link and answer a few questions through the six sections. You can build build your mortgage solution in less than 3 minutes
HOW_IT_WORKS.QUESTION2TITLE: Q: When should I expect to hear back?
HOW_IT_WORKS.QUESTION2SECTION: You will hear from us within 24 hours of applying, guarantee. If you do not, you will receive a $200 cash back credit on the funding date
HOW_IT_WORKS.QUESTION3TITLE: Q: I have weak credit score, will I still qualify?
HOW_IT_WORKS.QUESTION3SECTION: We work with clients who have different credit scores. With our extensive network of lenders, we will help you with your mortgage regardless of your credit history
HOW_IT_WORKS.QUESTION4TITLE: Q: How long does it take to go from applying to funding?
HOW_IT_WORKS.QUESTION4SECTION: The shortest time we have helped fund our clients are within 48 hours. This depends on a case by case basis. A good rule of thumb is to give yourself about one to two weeks of time to the required funding date.
HOW_IT_WORKS.LASTLINESEC1: If you are not satisfied with how your mortgage is handled, please contact
HOW_IT_WORKS.LASTLINESEC2: right away and we will help you make it right.

FAQ.FAQ1SECTION: 首付是指您为购房所支付的房价的一部分金额。您未支付的那部分金额即为贷款金额。如果您的首付比例达到20%或以上，则属于常规房屋贷款。不超过房屋购买价格或房屋价值（以较低者为准）80%的房屋贷款。超出这一限额的房屋贷款必须进行保险以防违约（由CMHC或Genworth承保），该房贷被称作高比例房屋贷款。如果您的首付比例不足20%，则属于高比例房屋贷款。如果购房者的定金低于购买价（或房产价值，以较低者为准）的20%，则您的房屋贷款必须由房屋贷款保险商（比如CMHC）提供还款违约保险。
FAQ.FAQ2TITLE: Q: What happens if I don’t have the full down payment amount?
FAQ.FAQ2SECTION: There are programs available that enable you to use other forms of down payment, such as from your RRSPs, a cash-back product, or a gift.
FAQ.FAQ3TITLE: Q: What will a lender look at when qualifying me for a mortgage?
FAQ.FAQ3SECTION: Most lenders look at six factors when determining whether you qualify for a mortgage:
FAQ.FAQ3SECTION_LI1_CONTENT: One of the first things a lender will consider is how much of your total income you’ll be spending on housing. This helps the lender decide whether you can comfortably afford a house.
FAQ.FAQ3SECTION_LI2_CONTENT: A lender will then look at your debts, which generally include monthly house payments as well as payments on all loans, credit cards, child support, etc.
FAQ.FAQ3SECTION_LI3_CONTENT: A history of steady employment, usually within the same job for several years, helps you qualify. But a short history in your current job shouldn’t prevent you from getting a mortgage, as long as there have been no gaps in income over the past two years.
FAQ.FAQ3SECTION_LI4_CONTENT: Good credit is also very important in qualifying for a mortgage.
FAQ.FAQ3SECTION_LI5_CONTENT: The lender will also want to know that the house is worth the price you plan to pay.
FAQ.FAQ3SECTION_LI6_CONTENT: The larger your downpayment, the higher chance you will get approved.
FAQ.FAQ4TITLE: 問: 固定利率与浮动利率?
FAQ.FAQ4SECTION: 固定利率是指您的利率以及本金和利息还款额在整个房屋贷款期限内不变。如果您是首次购房者，并且希望了解须偿还的确切金额，固定利率房屋贷款将是明智的选择。对于浮动利率房屋贷款，利率将随着道明房屋贷款最优惠利率的变化而波动。您的本金和利息还款额将在房屋贷款期限内保持不变，但如果道明房屋贷款最优惠利率降低，则还款额中用于偿还本金的金额将提高。如果道明房屋贷款最优惠利率上调，则用于偿还利息的金额将提高1。如果您担心利率上调，则固定利率房屋贷款将是更适合的选择，因为在房屋贷款期限内，您的利率不会提高。如果利率下调，则浮动利率房屋贷款将是更适宜的选择。如果您选择了浮动利率房屋贷款，而利率开始上升，您可以选择改为固定利率房屋贷款，利率以现行利率为准，具体须遵守某些条件。
FAQ.FAQ5TITLE: Q: What credit score do I need to qualify?
FAQ.FAQ5SECTION: Generally speaking, you’re a prime candidate for a mortgage if your credit score is 680 and above. The higher you can get above 700 the better, as you will qualify for the lowest rates. These days almost anyone can obtain a mortgage, but the key for those with lower credit scores is the size of the down payment. If you have a sufficient downpayment, you can reduce the risk to the lender providing you with the mortgage. Statistics show that default rates on mortgages decline as the downpayment increases.
FAQ.FAQ6TITLE: Q: What happens if my credit score isn’t great?
FAQ.FAQ6SECTION: There are several things you can do to boost your credit fairly quickly.
FAQ.FAQ6SECTION_LI1_CONTENT: The number one way to increase your credit score is to pay down your credit cards so they’re below 70% of your limits. Revolving credit like credit cards seems to have a more significant impact on credit scores than car loans, lines of credit, and so on.
FAQ.FAQ6SECTION_LI2_HEAD: Limit the use of credit cards:
FAQ.FAQ6SECTION_LI2_CONTENT: Racking up a large amount and then paying it off in monthly instalments can hurt your credit score. If there is a balance at the end of the month, this affects your score – credit formulas don’t take into account the fact that you may have paid the balance off the next month.
FAQ.FAQ6SECTION_LI3_CONTENT: If your lender is slower at reporting monthly transactions, this can have a significant impact on how other lenders view your file. Ensure everything’s up to date as old bills that have been paid can come back to haunt you. Some financial institutions don’t even report your maximum limits. As such, the credit bureau is left to only use the balance that’s on hand. The problem is, if you consistently charge the same amount each month – say $1,000 to $1,500 – it may appear to the credit-scoring agencies that you’re regularly maxing out your cards. The best bet is to pay your balances down or off before your statement periods close.
FAQ.FAQ6SECTION_LI4_CONTENT: Older credit is better credit. If you stop using older credit cards, the issuers may stop updating your accounts. As such, the cards can lose their weight in the credit formula and, therefore, may not be as valuable – even though you have had the cards for a long time. Use these cards periodically and then pay them off.
FAQ.FAQ6SECTION_LI5_CONTENT: Always dispute any mistakes or situations that may harm your score. If, for instance, a cell phone bill is incorrect and the company will not amend it, you can dispute this by making the credit bureau aware of the situation.
FAQ.FAQ7TITLE: Q: What will my mortgage rate be?
FAQ.FAQ7SECTION: What always seems to be everyone’s number one concern is saving money. Your mortgage rate depends on a lot of factors.
FAQ.FAQ7SECTION_EXAMPLE: For example, if you have bad credit history and a low down payment, expect a higher rate versus someone with a flawless credit history and a large down payment. The mortgage rate you  receive will be based on your profile, such as credit score and the property. Most people spend a lot of time to shop around, but through us, we will do the shopping for you. By using us, we will shop through different mortgage lenders and help you familiarize with the process so that there are no surprises.
FAQ.FAQ8TITLE: Q: How long is my mortgage rate good for?
FAQ.FAQ8SECTION: There is a difference in getting a quote on a mortgage rate verus a locked-in rate. With us, once you are happy with the quoted rate, we will finalize the details with the lender and lock in the rate, so even if rates change from one day to the next, your rate won’t.
FAQ.FAQ9TITLE: Q: How do you calculate a mortgage payment?
FAQ.FAQ9SECTION: Your mortgage payment is calculated based on the amount you borrow, the agreed mortgage rate, and the term of the mortgage. You can try our
FAQ.FAQ10SECTION: Refinancing simply means obtaining new financing for something you already own (or partially own, like real estate). If you currently have a rate of 5% on your mortgage, but see that refinance rates are now 3%, a refinance could save you money. You’d essentially have one lender pay off your existing loan with a brand new loan at the lower interest rate.
FAQ.FAQ11TITLE: Q: When is the first payment due?
FAQ.FAQ11SECTION: This depends on when you close your home and what your payment schedule is. Generally speaking, your first payment will be on the next payment schedule.
FAQ.FAQ12TITLE: Q: How much will I have to pay for closing costs?
FAQ.FAQ12SECTION: As a general rule of thumb, it’s recommended that you put aside at least 1.5% of the purchase price (in addition to the down payment) strictly to cover closing costs. There are several items you should budget for when it comes to closing costs.
FAQ.FAQ12SECTION_LI1: Property Transfer Tax is charged whenever a property is purchased. The tax will vary from jurisdiction to jurisdiction. You can use our
FAQ.FAQ12SECTION_LI2: GST/HST is only charged on new homes, and does not affect homes priced at less than $400,000. Even homes that exceed the price threshold are only taxed on the portion that exceeds $400,000. Certain conditions may apply.
FAQ.FAQ12SECTION_LI3: Your lawyer/notary will charge you a fee for drawing up the mortgage and conveyance of title. The amount of the fee will depend on the individual that you use. The typical cost is $900 to $1,200.
FAQ.FAQ12SECTION_LI4: If you’re purchasing a single-family home, you’ll need to give your lender a survey certificate showing where the property sits within the property lines. Some exceptions are made, however, on low loan-to-value deals and acreage properties. A survey will cost approximately $300-$350, but the lender will often accept a copy of an existing survey.
FAQ.FAQ12SECTION_LI5: Other costs include such things as an appraisal fee (approximately $200), title insurance and a home inspection (approximately $350).
